edge: Gotti was tasked by Dellacroce to kill McBratney for kidnapping and murdering Carlo Gambino's nephew.

Gotti served 4 years at Green Haven due to his involvement in McBratney's murder, but was released on medical furloughs both for appointments with the family's dentist and for conducting further criminal business.
Gotti reunited with his wife and children at their new residence in Howard Beach after being paroled from Green Haven.
Gotti operated out of the Bergin Hunt and Fish Club with his childhood friend Angelo Ruggiero.
Gotti mistrusted the Lucchese crime family's top underboss, Anthony Casso.
DeCicco counseled and warned Gotti against mistrusting Casso.
Gotti's middle son Frank was accidentally struck and killed by a car driven by Frederick DeFilippo, Gotti's next-door neighbor.
Relationship between father and son, Anthony's middle son Frank was accidentally struck and killed by a car on March 18, 1980.
John Favara, Anthony's neighbor was the driver who accidentally struck and killed Frank on March 18, 1980. Later, John disappeared on July 28.
The only witness to John's abduction, diner owner Leon Papon was intimidated into silence.
Paul Castellano was the boss of the Gambino family until his death in December 1985.
John Gotti was close to Anthony Casso, whose son Frank died in a car accident on March 18, 1980.
Willy Boy Johnson was a close associate of John Gotti and the Gambino family until his death in August 1988. He had been a confidential informant for the FBI since 1966.
Dellacroce was John Gotti's mentor and helped him secure the approval of the Five Families to eliminate Paul Castellano.
On December 16, 1985, Paul Castellano and his bodyguard Thomas Bilotti were gunned down outside Sparks Steak House.
Succeeded Castellano as head of the Gambino crime family after his assassination
Survived a car bomb intended for him, which DeCicco also survived but later died from the same method of attack
Reconciled with before excommunicating him to shield him from further retribution after he plotted against Gotti with rival boss Vincent 'The Chin' Gigante
Was charged with organizing Castellano's murder, with Gravano testifying against him during his fourth trial in 1992
Succeeded Gotti after he was sentenced to life imprisonment without parole in 1992 for organizing Castellano's murder
Assumed control over the Gambino crime family after his induction in 1988, following his father's fourth trial for organizing Castellano's murder
Had several family members killed by rivals while he was in control of the organization
Married Junior's wife Kim in April 1990, while Gotti was still in charge of the organization

node_2: united states medical center for federal prisoners
edge: On February 5, 1999, he visits his now-ailing father at the United States Medical Center for Federal Prisoners in Springfield, Missouri, to inform him that he is considering a plea bargain.
After Gotti dies on June 10, 2002 from throat cancer, Junior chooses to abandon his criminal life for his own family's sake.
After five trials, he is finally released from prison in December 2009.
